- firstly i would like to say hi to everyone as a returning member absent 
since 2003. good to be back online and well informed

-i am taking a trip to japan in september, OSAKA TOKYO HIROSHIMA AND 
TAKAMATSU. I was wondering if anyone had anyidea if there was anything of 
interest n these area's for a japanese history buff that is NOT to be found 
in the usual tourist guides and history books. if anyone is familiar with 
these area's it would be great if you could pass on any info, or words of 
wisdom.

- third and finally (this is a bit of a weird one). i have a large interest 
in the unification of japan, ieyasu and co. i recently heard that written 
music originated in china about 600BC. i am well educated in music(grade 8 
theory) and am looking for information on medieval japanese munuscripts. i'm 
after books and websites with examples of the style they used to record 
music. i am totally ignorant,as western music is taught with only the 
western history. would be great if i could get hold of some medieval 
japanese music in western manuscript, in order to get my tiny brain round 
it. honestly, any information at all would be well appreciated.


greets
